meanings.definition: To cook by exposure to radiant heat.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy branning marshmallows over the campfire.
meanings.sent2: She is branning the chicken in the oven for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chef was branning the vegetables with a flamethrower - what a show!
meanings.sent4: The sun was branning the earth with its scorching rays.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith was branning the metal until it glowed red hot.

meanings.sent1: The cat was branning across the room chasing a toy.
meanings.sent2: He branned out of the room when he heard the loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was branning up and down the tree in search of nuts.
meanings.sent4: The wind was branning through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle.
meanings.sent5: The car was branning down the highway at top speed.

meanings.sent1: The sudden branning of the balloon startled everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: With a branning, the door burst open and in rushed the excited children.
meanings.sent3: The clown's branning entrance on a unicycle brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected branning of confetti filled the air with color and joy.
meanings.sent5: The branning of fireworks lit up the night sky in a dazzling display.
